definition: to feel vexed/to bother/to trouble/superfluous and confusing/edgy

sentences.english: Temperature taking is intrusive and will upset the child.
sentences.chinese: 测量体温是对小儿烦扰，会使小儿不安。

sentences.english: She tormented me with some silly questions.
sentences.chinese: 她问了些无聊问题烦扰我。

sentences.english: To be so strong that nothing can disturb your peace of mind.
sentences.chinese: 要坚强，不让任何事物烦扰内心的平和。

sentences.english: Having one of those days or weeks when everything seems to annoy you?
sentences.chinese: 有的这些天或数周当一切似乎烦扰你一个吗？

sentences.english: She has been plaguing me with silly questions all day.
sentences.chinese: 她整天用愚蠢的问题烦扰我。

sentences.english: It was thus most disturbing to Heisenberg.
sentences.chinese: 因此这是最令海森堡烦扰的地方。

sentences.english: Possession hinders enjoyment and increase annoyance whethe_r you lend or keep.
sentences.chinese: 占有总是妨碍享受，徒增烦扰，无论你借出还是厮守。

sentences.english: Recognize that news doesn't have to be driven by disturbing pictures.
sentences.chinese: 承认新闻不总是由那些烦扰的图片驱动的。

sentences.english: Her government's collapse ends a harried year for Ms Radicova.
sentences.chinese: 拉迪乔娃的政府在这一年不断的烦扰下最终垮台。

sentences.english: He dingdonged the complaints into us.
sentences.chinese: 他用反复抱怨烦扰我们。

sentences.english: Donny played his guitar loudly to bother his brother.
sentences.chinese: 唐尼大声地弹吉他来烦扰他弟弟。

sentences.english: The opposite feeling to one expressed by seijaku would be noise and disturbance.
sentences.chinese: 和静表达出来的感觉相反的将是嘈杂和烦扰。

sentences.english: Being a teenager whose parents have handed him or her to the care of the state must be intensely disturbing.
sentences.chinese: 被父母送到州内去看护的青少年一定感觉很烦扰。

sentences.english: I will not burden you with a lot of questions.
sentences.chinese: 我不会提许多问题来烦扰你的。

sentences.english: If he bothers you again, I will give him an earful .
sentences.chinese: 如果他再来烦扰你，我将会给他一顿训斥。

sentences.english: Worry, fear, self-distrust bows the heart and turns the spirit back to dusk.
sentences.chinese: 烦扰惶恐，缺乏自信，人之心则易扭曲，意气如灰。
